intro: Hypericum quinquenervium, commonly known as the five-veined St. John's wort, is a perennial shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with five distinct veins. The plant thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Its stems are typically woody and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Hypericum quinquenervium is part of the Hypericaceae family and is known for its historical use in herbal medicine.
